briefdescription.para: Default constructor.
Constructor.

detaileddescription.para: Non-abstract property classes should have constructor of this style:

briefdescription.para: Virtual destructor.

detaileddescription.para: It is customary for derived properties to implement this.

briefdescription.para: This virtual function is called after m_value has been set.

listitem.para: If m_value was set to Null variant (ie. unspecified value), OnSetValue() will not be called.
m_value may be of any variant type. Typically properties internally support only one variant type, and as such OnSetValue() provides a good opportunity to convert supported values into internal type.

briefdescription.para: Override this to return something else than m_value as the value.
Implement this function in derived class to check the value.

detaileddescription.para: Return true if it is ok. Returning false prevents property change events from occurring.

briefdescription.para: Converts text into wxVariant value appropriate for this property.

detaileddescription.para:
variant
On function entry this is the old value (should not be wxNullVariant in normal cases). Translated value must be assigned back to it.
text
Text to be translated into variant.
argFlags
If wxPG_FULL_VALUE is set, returns complete, storable value instead of displayable one (they may be different). If wxPG_COMPOSITE_FRAGMENT is set, text is interpreted as a part of composite property string value (as generated by ValueToString() called with this same flag).
Returns true if resulting wxVariant value was different.
Default implementation converts semicolon delimited tokens into child values. Only works for properties with children. You might want to take into account that m_value is Null variant if property value is unspecified (which is usually only case if you explicitly enabled that sort behaviour).

briefdescription.para: Converts integer (possibly a choice selection) into wxVariant value appropriate for this property.

parameterdescription.para: On function entry this is the old value (should not be wxNullVariant in normal cases). Translated value must be assigned back to it.
Integer to be translated into variant.
If wxPG_FULL_VALUE is set, returns complete, storable value instead of displayable one.

simplesect.para: Returns true if resulting wxVariant value was different.

listitem.para: If property is not supposed to use choice or spinctrl or other editor with int-based value, it is not necessary to implement this method.
Default implementation simply assign given int to m_value.
If property uses choice control, and displays a dialog on some choice items, then it is preferred to display that dialog in IntToValue instead of OnEvent.
You might want to take into account that m_value is Mull variant if property value is unspecified (which is usually only case if you explicitly enabled that sort behaviour).

briefdescription.para: Converts property value into a text representation.

parameterdescription.para: Value to be converted.

If 0 (default value), then displayed string is returned. If wxPG_FULL_VALUE is set, returns complete, storable string value instead of displayable. If wxPG_EDITABLE_VALUE is set, returns string value that must be editable in textctrl. If wxPG_COMPOSITE_FRAGMENT is set, returns text that is appropriate to display as a part of string property's composite text representation.

simplesect.para: Default implementation calls GenerateComposedValue().

briefdescription.para: Converts string to a value, and if successful, calls SetValue() on it.

detaileddescription.para: Default behaviour is to do nothing.

parameterdescription.para: String to get the value from.

simplesect.para: true if value was changed.

briefdescription.para: Converts integer to a value, and if successful, calls SetValue() on it.

detaileddescription.para: Default behaviour is to do nothing.

parameterdescription.para: Int to get the value from.
If has wxPG_FULL_VALUE, then the value given is a actual value and not an index.

simplesect.para: true if value was changed.

briefdescription.para: Returns size of the custom painted image in front of property.

detaileddescription.para: This method must be overridden to return non-default value if OnCustomPaint is to be called.

parameterdescription.para: Normally -1, but can be an index to the property's list of items.

listitem.para: Default behaviour is to return wxSize(0,0), which means no image.
Default image width or height is indicated with dimension -1.
You can also return wxPG_DEFAULT_IMAGE_SIZE which equals wxSize(-1, -1).

briefdescription.para: Events received by editor widgets are processed here.

detaileddescription.para: Note that editor class usually processes most events. Some, such as button press events of TextCtrlAndButton class, can be handled here. Also, if custom handling for regular events is desired, then that can also be done (for example, wxSystemColourProperty custom handles wxEVT_CHOICE to display colour picker dialog when 'custom' selection is made).
If the event causes value to be changed, SetValueInEvent() should be called to set the new value.
The parameter event is the associated wxEvent.

parameterdescription.para: return true if any changes in value should be reported.

listitem.para: If property uses choice control, and displays a dialog on some choice items, then it is preferred to display that dialog in IntToValue instead of OnEvent.

briefdescription.para: Called after value of a child property has been altered.

detaileddescription.para: Must return new value of the whole property (after any alterations warranted by child's new value).

Note that this function is usually called at the time that value of this property, or given child property, is still pending for change, and as such, result of GetValue() or m_value should not be relied on.
Sample pseudo-code implementation:

parameterdescription.para: Value of this property. Changed value should be returned (in previous versions of wxPropertyGrid it was only necessary to write value back to this argument).
Index of child changed (you can use Item(childIndex) to get child property).
(Pending) value of the child property.

simplesect.para: Modified value of the whole property.

briefdescription.para: Returns pointer to an instance of used editor.
Returns pointer to the wxValidator that should be used with the editor of this property (NULL for no validator).

detaileddescription.para: Setting validator explicitly via SetPropertyValidator will override this.
In most situations, code like this should work well (macros are used to maintain one actual validator instance, so on the second call the function exits within the first macro):

simplesect.para: You can get common filename validator by returning wxFileProperty::GetClassValidator(). wxDirProperty, for example, uses it.

briefdescription.para: Override to paint an image in front of the property value text or drop-down list item (but only if wxPGProperty::OnMeasureImage is overridden as well).

detaileddescription.para: If property's OnMeasureImage() returns size that has height != 0 but less than row height ( < 0 has special meanings), wxPropertyGrid calls this method to draw a custom image in a limited area in front of the editor control or value text/graphics, and if control has drop-down list, then the image is drawn there as well (even in the case OnMeasureImage() returned higher height than row height).

NOTE: Following applies when OnMeasureImage() returns a "flexible" height ( using wxPG_FLEXIBLE_SIZE(W,H) macro), which implies variable height items: If rect.x is < 0, then this is a measure item call, which means that dc is invalid and only thing that should be done is to set paintdata.m_drawnHeight to the height of the image of item at index paintdata.m_choiceItem. This call may be done even as often as once every drop-down popup show.

parameterdescription.para: wxDC to paint on.
Box reserved for custom graphics. Includes surrounding rectangle, if any. If x is < 0, then this is a measure item call (see above).

listitem.para: You can actually exceed rect width, but if you do so then paintdata.m_drawnWidth must be set to the full width drawn in pixels.
Due to technical reasons, rect's height will be default even if custom height was reported during measure call.
Brush is guaranteed to be default background colour. It has been already used to clear the background of area being painted. It can be modified.
Pen is guaranteed to be 1-wide 'black' (or whatever is the proper colour) pen for drawing framing rectangle. It can be changed as well.

briefdescription.para: Returns used wxPGCellRenderer instance for given property column (label=0, value=1).

detaileddescription.para: Default implementation returns editor's renderer for all columns.

briefdescription.para: Returns which choice is currently selected.

detaileddescription.para: Only applies to properties which have choices.
Needs to reimplemented in derived class if property value does not map directly to a choice. Integer as index, bool, and string usually do.

briefdescription.para: Refresh values of child properties.

detaileddescription.para: Automatically called after value is set.

briefdescription.para: Reimplement this member function to add special handling for attributes of this property.

simplesect.para: Return false to have the attribute automatically stored in m_attributes. Default implementation simply does that and nothing else.
To actually set property attribute values from the application, use wxPGProperty::SetAttribute() instead.

briefdescription.para: Returns value of an attribute.

detaileddescription.para: Override if custom handling of attributes is needed.
Default implementation simply return NULL variant.

briefdescription.para: Returns instance of a new wxPGEditorDialogAdapter instance, which is used when user presses the (optional) button next to the editor control;.

detaileddescription.para: Default implementation returns NULL (ie. no action is generated when button is pressed).

briefdescription.para: Called whenever validation has failed with given pending value.

simplesect.para: If you implement this in your custom property class, please remember to call the baser implementation as well, since they may use it to revert property into pre-change state.

briefdescription.para: Append a new choice to property's list of choices.

parameterdescription.para: Label for added choice.
Value for new choice. Do not specify if you wish this to equal choice index.

simplesect.para: Index to added choice.

briefdescription.para: Adds a private child property.
Adds a private child property.

detaileddescription.para: If you use this instead of wxPropertyGridInterface::Insert() or wxPropertyGridInterface::AppendIn(), then property's parental type will automatically be set up to wxPG_PROP_AGGREGATE. In other words, all properties of this property will become private.

briefdescription.para: Adapts list variant into proper value using consecutive ChildChanged() calls.
Use this member function to add independent (ie.

detaileddescription.para: regular) children to a property.

simplesect.para: Appended childProperty.
wxPropertyGrid is not automatically refreshed by this function.
InsertChild(), AddPrivateChild()

briefdescription.para: Determines, recursively, if all children are not unspecified.

parameterdescription.para: Assumes members in this wxVariant list as pending replacement values.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if children of this property are component values (for instance, points size, face name, and is_underlined are component values of a font).
Sets or clears given property flag.

detaileddescription.para: Mainly for internal use.

simplesect.para: Setting a property flag never has any side-effect, and is intended almost exclusively for internal use. So, for example, if you want to disable a property, call Enable(false) instead of setting wxPG_PROP_DISABLED flag.
HasFlag(), GetFlags()

briefdescription.para: Deletes children of the property.
Removes entry from property's wxPGChoices and editor control (if it is active).

detaileddescription.para: If selected item is deleted, then the value is set to unspecified.

briefdescription.para: Enables or disables the property.

detaileddescription.para: Disabled property usually appears as having grey text.

parameterdescription.para: If false, property is disabled instead.

briefdescription.para: Call to enable or disable usage of common value (integer value that can be selected for properties instead of their normal values) for this property.

detaileddescription.para: Common values are disabled by the default for all properties.

briefdescription.para: Composes text from values of child properties.
Returns property attribute value, null variant if not found.
Returns named attribute, as string, if found.

detaileddescription.para: Otherwise defVal is returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns named attribute, as long, if found.

detaileddescription.para: Otherwise defVal is returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns named attribute, as double, if found.

detaileddescription.para: Otherwise defVal is returned.

briefdescription.para: Returns attributes as list wxVariant.
Return atributes storage map.
Returns editor used for given column.

detaileddescription.para: NULL for no editor.

briefdescription.para: Returns property's base name (ie.

detaileddescription.para: parent's name is not added in any case)

briefdescription.para: Returns wxPGCell of given column.

simplesect.para: const version of this member function returns 'default' wxPGCell object if the property itself didn't hold cell data.

briefdescription.para: Returns wxPGCell of given column, creating one if necessary.
Returns wxPGCell of given column, creating one if necessary.
Returns number of child properties.
Returns height of children, recursively, and by taking expanded/collapsed status into account.

parameterdescription.para: Line height. Pass result of GetGrid()->GetRowHeight() here.
Only used (internally) when finding property y-positions.

briefdescription.para: Returns read-only reference to property's list of choices.
Returns client data (void*) of a property.
Sets managed client object of a property.
Returns property's default value.

detaileddescription.para: If property's value type is not a built-in one, and "DefaultValue" attribute is not defined, then this function usually returns Null variant.

briefdescription.para: Returns property's displayed text.
Returns wxPGEditor that will be used and created when property becomes selected.

detaileddescription.para: Returns more accurate value than DoGetEditorClass().

briefdescription.para: Returns property flags.
Returns property grid where property lies.
Returns owner wxPropertyGrid, but only if one is currently on a page displaying this property.
Returns property's help or description text.
Returns position in parent's array.
Returns property's label.
Returns last visible child property, recursively.
Returns highest level non-category, non-root parent.

detaileddescription.para: Useful when you have nested properties with children.

simplesect.para: If immediate parent is root or category, this will return the property itself.

briefdescription.para: Returns maximum allowed length of property's text value.
Returns property's name with all (non-category, non-root) parents.
Return parent of property.
Returns (direct) child property with given name (or NULL if not found).
Gets assignable version of property's validator.
Returns property's value.
Returns bitmap that appears next to value text.

detaileddescription.para: Only returns non-NULL bitmap if one was set with SetValueImage().

briefdescription.para: Returns text representation of property's value.

parameterdescription.para: If 0 (default value), then displayed string is returned. If wxPG_FULL_VALUE is set, returns complete, storable string value instead of displayable. If wxPG_EDITABLE_VALUE is set, returns string value that must be editable in textctrl. If wxPG_COMPOSITE_FRAGMENT is set, returns text that is appropriate to display as a part of string property's composite text representation.

simplesect.para: In older versions, this function used to be overridden to convert property's value into a string representation. This function is now handled by ValueToString(), and overriding this function now will result in run-time assertion failure.

briefdescription.para: Synonymous to GetValueAsString().
Returns value type used by this property.
Returns coordinate to the top y of the property.

detaileddescription.para: Note that the position of scrollbars is not taken into account.

briefdescription.para: Returns non-zero if property has given flag set.

simplesect.para: propgrid_propflags

briefdescription.para: Returns true if property has even one visible child.
Hides or reveals the property.

parameterdescription.para: true for hide, false for reveal.
By default changes are applied recursively. Set this parameter wxPG_DONT_RECURSE to prevent this.

briefdescription.para: Returns index of given child property.

detaileddescription.para: wxNOT_FOUND if given property is not child of this.

briefdescription.para: Use this member function to add independent (ie.

detaileddescription.para: regular) children to a property.

simplesect.para: Inserted childProperty.
wxPropertyGrid is not automatically refreshed by this function.
AppendChild(), AddPrivateChild()

briefdescription.para: Inserts a new choice to property's list of choices.

parameterdescription.para: Text for new choice
Insertion position. Use wxNOT_FOUND to append.
Value for new choice. Do not specify if you wish this to equal choice index.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if this property is actually a wxPropertyCategory.
Returns true if property is enabled.
Returns true if property has visible children.
Returns true if this property is actually a wxRootProperty.
Returns true if this is a sub-property.
Returns true if candidateParent is some parent of this property.
Returns true if property has editable wxTextCtrl when selected.

simplesect.para: Although disabled properties do not displayed editor, they still return true here as being disabled is considered a temporary condition (unlike being read-only or having limited editing enabled).

briefdescription.para: Returns true if property's value is considered unspecified.

detaileddescription.para: This usually means that value is Null variant.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if all parents expanded.
Returns child property at index i.
If property's editor is active, then update it's value.
Sets an attribute for this property.

parameterdescription.para: Text identifier of attribute. See wxPropertyGrid Property Attribute Identifiers.
Value of attribute.

simplesect.para: Setting attribute's value to Null variant will simply remove it from property's set of attributes.

briefdescription.para: Set if user can change the property's value to unspecified by modifying the value of the editor control (usually by clearing it).

detaileddescription.para: Currently, this can work with following properties: wxIntProperty, wxUIntProperty, wxFloatProperty, wxEditEnumProperty.

parameterdescription.para: Whether to enable or disable this behaviour (it is disabled by default).

briefdescription.para: Sets property's background colour.

parameterdescription.para: Background colour to use.
Default is wxPG_RECURSE which causes colour to be set recursively. Omit this flag to only set colour for the property in question and not any of its children.

briefdescription.para: Sets editor for a property.

detaileddescription.para:
editor
For builtin editors, use wxPGEditor_X, where X is builtin editor's name (TextCtrl, Choice, etc. see wxPGEditor documentation for full list).
For custom editors, use pointer you received from wxPropertyGrid::RegisterEditorClass().

briefdescription.para: Sets editor for a property, by editor name.
Sets cell information for given column.
Sets new set of choices for the property.

simplesect.para: This operation deselects the property and clears its value.

briefdescription.para: Sets client data (void*) of a property.

simplesect.para: This untyped client data has to be deleted manually.

briefdescription.para: Returns client object of a property.
Sets selected choice and changes property value.

detaileddescription.para: Tries to retain value type, although currently if it is not string, then it is forced to integer.

briefdescription.para: Set default value of a property.

detaileddescription.para: Synonymous to

briefdescription.para: Sets or clears given property flag, recursively.

detaileddescription.para: This function is primarily intended for internal use.

briefdescription.para: Sets property's help string, which is shown, for example, in wxPropertyGridManager's description text box.
Sets property's label.

simplesect.para: Properties under same parent may have same labels. However, property names must still remain unique.

briefdescription.para: Set max length of text in text editor.
Sets property's "is it modified?" flag.

detaileddescription.para: Affects children recursively.

briefdescription.para: Sets new (base) name for property.
Changes what sort of parent this property is for its children.

parameterdescription.para: Use one of the following values: wxPG_PROP_MISC_PARENT (for generic parents), wxPG_PROP_CATEGORY (for categories), or wxPG_PROP_AGGREGATE (for derived property classes with private children).

simplesect.para: You generally do not need to call this function.

briefdescription.para: Sets property's text colour.

parameterdescription.para: Text colour to use.
Default is wxPG_RECURSE which causes colour to be set recursively. Omit this flag to only set colour for the property in question and not any of its children.

briefdescription.para: Sets wxValidator for a property.
Call this to set value of the property.

detaileddescription.para: Unlike methods in wxPropertyGrid, this does not automatically update the display.

Use wxPropertyGrid::ChangePropertyValue() instead if you need to run through validation process and send property change event. If you need to change property value in event, based on user input, use SetValueInEvent() instead.

parameterdescription.para: The value to set.
Pointer to list variant that contains child values. Used to indicate which children should be marked as modified. Usually you just use NULL.
wxPG_SETVAL_REFRESH_EDITOR is set by default, to refresh editor and redraw properties.

briefdescription.para: Set wxBitmap in front of the value.

detaileddescription.para: This bitmap may be ignored by custom cell renderers.

briefdescription.para: Call this function in OnEvent(), OnButtonClick() etc.

detaileddescription.para: to change the property value based on user input.

simplesect.para: This method is const since it doesn't actually modify value, but posts given variant as pending value, stored in wxPropertyGrid.

briefdescription.para: Sets property's value to unspecified (ie.

detaileddescription.para: Null variant).

briefdescription.para: Call with false in OnSetValue() to cancel value changes after all (ie.

detaileddescription.para: cancel true returned by StringToValue() or IntToValue()).

briefdescription.para: Updates composed values of parent non-category properties, recursively.

detaileddescription.para: Returns topmost property updated.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if containing grid uses wxPG_EX_AUTO_UNSPECIFIED_VALUES.
Helper for language bindings.
Deletes all child properties.
wxPGProperty is base class for all wxPropertyGrid properties.

detaileddescription.para: In sections below we cover few related topics.

sect1.title: Supplied Ready-to-use Property Classes
sect1.para: Here is a list and short description of supplied fully-functional property classes. They are located in either props.h or advprops.h.

sect2.title: wxPropertyCategory
sect2.para: Not an actual property per se, but a header for a group of properties. Regardless inherits from wxPGProperty, and supports displaying 'labels' for columns other than the first one. Easiest way to set category's label for second column is to call wxPGProperty::SetValue() with string argument.

sect2.title: wxStringProperty
sect2.para: Simple string property. wxPG_STRING_PASSWORD attribute may be used to echo value as asterisks and use wxTE_PASSWORD for wxTextCtrl. wxPG_ATTR_AUTOCOMPLETE attribute may be used to enable auto-completion (use a wxArrayString value), and is also supported by any property that happens to use a wxTextCtrl-based editor.

simplesect.para: wxStringProperty has a special trait: if it has value of "<composed>", and also has child properties, then its displayed value becomes composition of child property values, similar as with wxFontProperty, for instance.

sect2.title: wxIntProperty
sect2.para: Like wxStringProperty, but converts text to a signed long integer. wxIntProperty seamlessly supports 64-bit integers (ie. wxLongLong). To safely convert variant to integer, use code like this:

sect2.title: wxUIntProperty
sect2.para: Like wxIntProperty, but displays value as unsigned int. To set the prefix used globally, manipulate wxPG_UINT_PREFIX string attribute. To set the globally used base, manipulate wxPG_UINT_BASE int attribute. Regardless of current prefix, understands (hex) values starting with both "0x" and "$". Like wxIntProperty, wxUIntProperty seamlessly supports 64-bit unsigned integers (ie. wxULongLong). Same wxVariant safety rules apply.

sect2.title: wxFloatProperty
sect2.para: Like wxStringProperty, but converts text to a double-precision floating point. Default float-to-text precision is 6 decimals, but this can be changed by modifying wxPG_FLOAT_PRECISION attribute.

Note that when displaying the value, sign is omitted if the resulting textual representation is effectively zero (for example, -0.0001 with precision of 3 will become 0.0 instead of -0.0). This behaviour is unlike what C standard library does, but should result in better end-user experience in almost all cases.

sect2.title: wxBoolProperty
sect2.para: Represents a boolean value. wxChoice is used as editor control, by the default. wxPG_BOOL_USE_CHECKBOX attribute can be set to true in order to use check box instead.

sect2.title: wxLongStringProperty
sect2.para: Like wxStringProperty, but has a button that triggers a small text editor dialog. Note that in long string values, tabs are represented by "\t" and line break by "\n".
To display custom dialog on button press, you can subclass wxLongStringProperty and implement OnButtonClick, like this:
Also, if you wish not to have line breaks and tabs translated to escape sequences, then do following in constructor of your subclass:

sect2.title: wxDirProperty
sect2.para: Like wxLongStringProperty, but the button triggers dir selector instead. Supported properties (all with string value): wxPG_DIR_DIALOG_MESSAGE.

sect2.title: wxFileProperty
sect2.para: Like wxLongStringProperty, but the button triggers file selector instead. Default wildcard is "All files..." but this can be changed by setting wxPG_FILE_WILDCARD attribute (see wxFileDialog for format details). Attribute wxPG_FILE_SHOW_FULL_PATH can be set to false in order to show only the filename, not the entire path.

sect2.title: wxEnumProperty
sect2.para: Represents a single selection from a list of choices - wxOwnerDrawnComboBox is used to edit the value.

sect2.title: wxFlagsProperty
sect2.para: Represents a bit set that fits in a long integer. wxBoolProperty sub- properties are created for editing individual bits. Textctrl is created to manually edit the flags as a text; a continuous sequence of spaces, commas and semicolons are considered as a flag id separator.
Note: When changing "choices" (ie. flag labels) of wxFlagsProperty, you will need to use wxPGProperty::SetChoices() - otherwise they will not get updated properly.
wxFlagsProperty supports the same attributes as wxBoolProperty.

sect2.title: wxArrayStringProperty
sect2.para: Allows editing of a list of strings in wxTextCtrl and in a separate dialog. Supports "Delimiter" attribute, which defaults to comma (',').

sect2.title: wxDateProperty
sect2.para: wxDateTime property. Default editor is DatePickerCtrl, although TextCtrl should work as well. wxPG_DATE_FORMAT attribute can be used to change string wxDateTime::Format uses (although default is recommended as it is locale-dependent), and wxPG_DATE_PICKER_STYLE allows changing window style given to DatePickerCtrl (default is wxDP_DEFAULT|wxDP_SHOWCENTURY). Using wxDP_ALLOWNONE will enable better unspecified value support.

sect2.title: wxEditEnumProperty
sect2.para: Represents a string that can be freely edited or selected from list of choices - custom combobox control is used to edit the value.

sect2.title: wxMultiChoiceProperty
sect2.para: Allows editing a multiple selection from a list of strings. This is property is pretty much built around concept of wxMultiChoiceDialog. It uses wxArrayString value.

sect2.title: wxImageFileProperty
sect2.para: Like wxFileProperty, but has thumbnail of the image in front of the filename and autogenerates wildcard from available image handlers.

sect2.title: wxColourProperty
sect2.para: Useful alternate editor: Choice.
Represents wxColour. wxButton is used to trigger a colour picker dialog. There are various sub-classing opportunities with this class. See below in wxSystemColourProperty section for details.
Setting "HasAlpha" attribute to true for this property allows user to edit the alpha colour component.

sect2.title: wxFontProperty
sect2.para: Represents wxFont. Various sub-properties are used to edit individual subvalues.

sect2.title: wxSystemColourProperty
sect2.para: Represents wxColour and a system colour index. wxChoice is used to edit the value. Drop-down list has color images. Note that value type is wxColourPropertyValue instead of wxColour (which wxColourProperty uses).
in wxSystemColourProperty, and its derived class wxColourProperty, there are various sub-classing features. To set a basic list of colour names, call wxPGProperty::SetChoices().

sect2.title: wxCursorProperty
sect2.para: Represents a wxCursor. wxChoice is used to edit the value. Drop-down list has cursor images under some (wxMSW) platforms.

sect1.title: Creating Custom Properties
sect1.para: New properties can be created by subclassing wxPGProperty or one of the provided property classes, and (re)implementing necessary member functions. Below, each virtual member function has ample documentation about its purpose and any odd details which to keep in mind.
Here is a very simple 'template' code:

Since wxPGProperty derives from wxObject, you can use standard wxDECLARE_DYNAMIC_CLASS and wxIMPLEMENT_DYNAMIC_CLASS macros. From the above example they were omitted for sake of simplicity, and besides, they are only really needed if you need to use wxRTTI with your property class.

You can change the 'value type' of a property by simply assigning different type of variant with SetValue. It is mandatory to implement wxVariantData class for all data types used as property values. You can use macros declared in wxPropertyGrid headers. For instance:
